page.title: 04COLDHARBOUR MILL, UFFCULME
page.content: {Coldharbour Mill}was purchased by the Coldharbour Mill Trust in January 1982. Mortgages were provided by the Parish, District and County Council. Restoration work was begun immediately with the aid of a Manpower Services Community Enterprises Workforce. It was opened to the public in July 1982 and by the end of the year 6000 people had come to see it. It is a working museum of the{West {Country Woollen Industry}and shows each stage of the manufacturing process from the raw wool to the finished product in the atmosphere of a{Victorian Factory.}Originally power was provided by a{water wheel}and {steam engine}running in harness.Both of these are being fully restored. The original owners were Fox Bros. of Wellington.Some of the present employees worked for Fox's formerly.
